title: Comey to Appear in Court in Case That Has Roiled Justice Dept.
summary: The case against James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, was deemed too thin by a previous federal prosecutor, who quit under pressure from President Trump.

title: Comey Goes to Court, and Gold Prices Hit Record High
summary: Plus, how job applicants are tricking A.I.

title: Trump’s H-1B Visa Fee Could Strain Universities and Schools
summary: Higher education leaders and public-school superintendents say they depend on skilled foreign workers to fill critical roles.

title: Senate Confirms Neil Jacobs, ‘Sharpiegate’ Meteorologist, to Lead NOAA
summary: Neil Jacobs was found to have violated NOAA’s code of ethics after an investigation into an incident that centered on an altered hurricane forecast map in 2019.

title: How the Right Uses Charlie Kirk’s Death to Further Their Policies
summary: The mayor of Lima, Peru, held a Charlie Kirk memorial — filled with attendees bused in from poor neighborhoods — as he sought help from the Trump administration.

title: Meet ‘Porky,’ Lima’s Right-Wing Mayor Embracing Trump’s MAGA Movement
summary: By embodying President Trump’s brash style, Rafael López Aliaga has become a leading candidate to be Peru’s next president.

title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry Awarded to Architects of Metal-Organic Frameworks
summary: The prize was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi for the development of a new type of molecular architecture.

title: Nobel Prizes 2025: What to Know
summary: The awards are being announced this week.

title: How Much It Costs to Drive an E.V. and a Gas Car in Every State
summary: Charging an electric car battery is usually cheaper than going to the gas pump. But it depends on where you live.

title: Supreme Court to Consider Illinois Mail-In Balloting Lawsuit
summary: The case, one of several challenges to mail-in ballot rules lodged by allies of President Trump, involves an effort to exclude votes received after Election Day.

title: Cheer Up, or Else: China Cracks Down on the Haters and Cynics
summary: As China struggles with economic discontent, internet censors are silencing those who voice doubts about work, marriage, or simply sigh too loudly online.

title: Why Is This Lake ‘Burping’?
summary: For hundreds of years, people who have lived near Seneca Lake in upstate New York have reported hearing loud booms coming from the water. No one is exactly sure why.

title: Civil Rights Lawyer Bryan Stevenson on How America’s Story Should Be Told
summary: The founder of the Equal Justice Initiative says it would be “dishonorable” to remain silent in the face of President Trump’s efforts.

title: In Syria, a Crackdown on Gunfire at Weddings
summary: Marriages and other glad occasions in Syria are often celebrated by firing shots in the air. But after nearly 14 years of war, people want the guns to go silent.

title: Fra Angelico and the Miracle of Faith Made Visible
summary: A once-in-a-generation exhibition in Italy shows how the Renaissance painter believed something with his whole heart, and then made it manifest.

title: Is This the End of an Era for Soul Food in Washington?
summary: As several of the city’s classic Black-owned restaurants close, some historians worry about the passing of a beloved tradition.

title: Tom Friedman on the Only Way to Solve the Israel-Hamas War
summary: Can Donald Trump end the “worst war” with the latest round of peace talks?

title: What the Shutdown Is Really About
summary: Obamacare premiums could double for millions of Americans if the law isn’t changed. Neera Tanden walks Ezra Klein through the shutdown’s policy stakes.

title: How ‘Les Mis’ Became So Successful
summary: We look at the story behind its more than 15,000-show run.

title: Josh Johnson to Trump: He’s Not ‘Puff Daddy’ Anymore
summary: The “Daily Show” host found comedic fodder in an Oval Office event about mining in Alaska, at which the president wound up talking about Sean Combs.

title: Oakland, California, Residents Are Fed Up With Illegal Dumping
summary: Many residents say that illegal dumping has inundated Oakland, Calif., a city with more garbage than almost anywhere else.

title: 200 Animals and a 95-Year-Old Are Found Inside a Squalid Suburban Home
summary: The woman was confined to her room by clutter, and a Long Island wildlife rehabilitator faces charges. The authorities found everything from cats to voles, many of them in dire conditions.

title: Carney and Trump: A Collision Avoided, Save for a Nasty Comment or Two
summary: The Canadian prime minister came to Washington determined to take the heat out of the relationship. He mostly succeeded, at least for now.

title: Myanmar Military Paraglider Bombs Buddhist Festival, Killing Dozens
summary: The junta targeted a  festival in the Sagaing region where people were also protesting army rule, according to witnesses and the civilian government in exile.
